oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Heroes; Men; Motion picture producers & directors; Contracts; Document signings
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World War, 1914-1918; Lasky, Jesse L., 1880-1958
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin York at the signing of the contract with Jesse Lasky for the movie about York's life. They are in front of the Taylor Hotel.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dr. Charles M. Smith, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jesse L. Lasky Sr. was a key founder of Paramount Pictures with Adolph Zukor. Lasky produced 138 movies during his career and is listed as the presenter on another 460. Samuel Goldwyn, of MGM fame, was his brother-in-law.
